section.name: Developing a workflow with Ant
section.p: Most of the tool support in Dalma comes in the form of a Maven plug-in, but if you'd like to build your workflow engine with Ant, you are welcome.

subsection.name: Copying jars to your workspace
subsection.p: First, download a main binary distribution (dalma-[version].zip) and then copy dalma-[version].jar and container/dalma-container-[version].jar to your workspace. You'll need those two jars for compiling your workflow applications.
Note that as long as you are deploying into the WebUI or the container, you won't have to redistribute these jars.

If your workflow application uses one or more endpoints, you'll need jar files that implement endpoints. Unlike the engine jar, these jar files do need to be redistributed with your workflow application.

subsection.name: Building a workspace
subsection.p: Building a workflow application is no different from building your ordinary Java application. Refer to this document for how to build a dar file for deployment into WebUI/container.
